Line 17: Line 17:
== Features ==
== Features ==
â
Ninite works on Windows XP, Windows Vista, Windows 7 and Debian-based variants of Linux, such as Ubuntu. It presents the user with a list of programs and generates a custom installer executable based on the user's selection <ref>http://lifehacker.com/5388408/ninite-bulk+installs-great-free-windows-apps</ref>. When run, the installer downloads and installs the selected applications. The authors of this program claim that their installer does not interfere with your system when you use it to install software chosen from their service<ref>http://ninite.com/</ref>, although the Linux version does send some information back to the developers.<ref>http://www.omgubuntu.co.uk/2010/09/ninite-for-linux-beta-released-installs-apps-for-you-though-can-it-be-trusted</ref>
+
Ninite works on Windows XP, Windows Vista, Windows 7 and [[Debian]]-based variants of Linux, such as [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]]. It presents the user with a list of programs and generates a custom installer executable based on the user's selection <ref>http://lifehacker.com/5388408/ninite-bulk+installs-great-free-windows-apps</ref>. When run, the installer downloads and installs the selected applications. The authors of this program claim that their installer does not interfere with your system when you use it to install software chosen from their service<ref>http://ninite.com/</ref>, although the Linux version does send some information back to the developers.<ref>http://www.omgubuntu.co.uk/2010/09/ninite-for-linux-beta-released-installs-apps-for-you-though-can-it-be-trusted</ref>
